snippet: In practice, Hezbollah and the United States are already working — separately — on a common goal: to stop the extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon.
lead_paragraph: In practice, Hezbollah and the United States are already working — separately — on a common goal: to stop the extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon.
abstract: Hezbollah and the United States are sworn enemies who insist they will never work together, but in practice they are already working--separately--on common goal of stopping extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon; Hezbollah is most powerful military and political player in country and shares with US an interest in stability.

lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister Saad Hariri, considered Lebanon’s most influential Sunni Muslim politician, returned unexpectedly to Lebanon on Friday after three years of self-imposed exile.
abstract: Saad Hariri, former prime minister of Lebanon who is considered country's most influential Sunni Muslim politician, returns home after three years of self-imposed exile; unexpected return is seen as bid to assert his leadership over Lebanon’s Sunni community amid growing concern that many Sunnis are being radicalized by the war in Syria.

snippet: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
lead_paragraph: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column highlights interview with Daniel Drennan, born in Beirut in 1963, and adopted by New Jersey couple through a Roman Catholic orphanage; Drennan, who has returned to Beirut and converted to Islam, is an anti-adoption activist who sees adoption a way that wealthier families and wealthier parts of world absorb children of families whose poverty they had a role in causing.

snippet: In a story Oct. 7, The Associated Press quoted the Israeli military as describing a Hezbollah blast that wounded two Israeli soldiers as a "breach of Israel's sovereignty." The story should have made clear that the attack took place in a disputed...
lead_paragraph: In a story Oct. 7, The Associated Press quoted the Israeli military as describing a Hezbollah blast that wounded two Israeli soldiers as a "breach of Israel's sovereignty." The story should have made clear that the attack took place in a disputed area, Shebaa Farms, where the borders of Israel, Lebanon and Syria meet. Israel says the enclave is part of the Golan Heights, which it captured from Syria in 1967. Lebanon and Syria say Shebaa Farms belong to Lebanon, while the United Nations says the area is part of Syria and that Damascus and Israel should negotiate its fate.

headline.main: Clarification: Israel-Lebanon Story
headline.print_headline: Clarification: Israel-Lebanon Story

snippet: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.
lead_paragraph: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.
abstract: Cease-fire between Syrian Islamist insurgents and Lebanese Army forces collapses almost immediately, raising new alarms about infectious spread of Syria's civil war into Lebanon; planned 24-hour break in fighting had been meant to provide window for medical workers and relief officials to extricate the wounded and provide aid for refugees around besieged town of Arsal.

headline.main: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly

snippet: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
lead_paragraph: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
abstract: Return of United States to Middle East three years after withdrawing from Iraq is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome among Arab nations; leading allies like Egypt, Jordan and Turkey are all finding ways to avoid specific commitments to Pres Obama's expanded effort against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; thirteen years of chaos have deepened political and sectarian divisions and increased mistrust of US on all sides.

headline.main: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS

lead_paragraph: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
abstract: Fighting between Lebanon's armed forces and Islamist insurgents from Syria worsens in most serious spillover of Syrian civil war in Lebanese territory to date; Lebanese Army counts its casualties from three days of fighting at 14 soldiers killed, 86 wounded and 22 missing; more than 20 Islamist fighters are also believed to be among those killed, but it is impossible to determine precise numbers.

headline.print_headline: Activists: Jihadi Killed Near Syria-Lebanon Border

snippet: The Obama administration said the company, Stars Group Holding, was used to buy equipment for surveillance drones flown over Syria and Israel.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said the company, Stars Group Holding, was used to buy equipment for surveillance drones flown over Syria and Israel.
abstract: Obama administration levels sanctions against Lebanon-based company Stars Group Holding, calling it a front for Shiite militant group Hezbollah; says firm was used to buy equipment for surveillance drones flown over Syria and Israel.

headline.main: U.S. Penalizes Firm It Calls a Front for Hezbollah

snippet: Lebanon on Thursday charged 43 Syrians, including an Islamist commander whose arrest sparked five days of fighting between Islamists and the Lebanese army, with belonging to armed terrorist groups and seeking to establish an Islamic emirate.

snippet: As part of a tourism project, the Hudson Valley town of New Lebanon, N.Y., is being reimagined as what it hopes will be a “living museum of contemporary rural American life.”
lead_paragraph: As part of a tourism project, the Hudson Valley town of New Lebanon, N.Y., is being reimagined as what it hopes will be a “living museum of contemporary rural American life.”
abstract: Behold! New Lebanon festival in Columbia County, NY, reimagines struggling Hudson Valley town as living museum of contemporary rural American life; festival is being packaged as deliberate contrast to nostalgia-fueled reenactments elsewhere; if effort succeeds, New Lebanon will join an emerging rural renaissance in which small towns are reinventing themselves by embracing local skills and artisanship.

headline.main: Green Acres, the Place to Be
headline.print_headline: Green Acres, the Place to Be

snippet: The United States has begun delivering nearly $20 million of arms including assault rifles, anti-tank missiles and mortars to bolster Lebanon's army after Islamist insurgents seized a border town for several days this month, U.S. officials said on...
lead_paragraph: The United States has begun delivering nearly $20 million of arms including assault rifles, anti-tank missiles and mortars to bolster Lebanon's army after Islamist insurgents seized a border town for several days this month, U.S. officials said on Friday.

headline.main: U.S. Sends Arms to Bolster Lebanon Army After Islamist Incursion
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sends Arms to Bolster Lebanon Army After Islamist Incursion

snippet: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
lead_paragraph: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
abstract: American forces take advantage of airstrikes against Islamic State extremist group in Syria to try and simultaneously wipe out leadership of Khorasan, unrelated cell of veterans of Al Qaeda; Obama administration says group was plotting 'imminent' attack against the United States or Europe.

headline.main: In Airstrikes, U.S. Targets Militant Cell Said to Plot an Attack Against the West
headline.print_headline: In Airstrikes, U.S. Targets Cell Said to Plot an Attack

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matt Apuzzo, Mark Mazzetti, Charlie Savage, Michael S. Schmidt, Eric Schmitt and Jonathan Weisman from Washington; Mark Landler and Somini Sengupta from New York; Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon; and Alan Cowell from London.

snippet: Kassem Eid, who helped make Moadhamiyeh a symbol of Syrian suffering after government forces blockaded the town in 2012, reluctantly decided to struggle from afar.
lead_paragraph: Kassem Eid, who helped make Moadhamiyeh a symbol of Syrian suffering after government forces blockaded the town in 2012, reluctantly decided to struggle from afar.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Kassem Eid, opposition activist and fighter who helped make Moadhamiyeh a symbol of Syrian suffering after Pres Bashar al-Assad's security forces blockaded the town in 2012; Eid's struggle for political rights has now been eclipsed by foreign-led extremists of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, who have exploited the chaos to seize control of large areas of both countries; Eid, caught between the government and extremists, has decided to join the exiles.

headline.main: A Weary Rebel Retreats to Fight Another Day
headline.print_headline: A Weary Rebel Retreats to Fight Another Day

snippet: At least two rockets were fired on Saturday from southern Lebanon toward Israel, Lebanon's national news agency and security sources said, without saying who had launched them.
lead_paragraph: At least two rockets were fired on Saturday from southern Lebanon toward Israel, Lebanon's national news agency and security sources said, without saying who had launched them.

headline.main: Rockets Fired From South Lebanon Toward Israel: News Agency
headline.print_headline: Rockets Fired From South Lebanon Toward Israel: News Agency

headline.print_headline: Militants Say Seeking Prisoner Swap With Lebanon

snippet: Henk Zanoli, 91, who saved a Jewish boy in 1943, said he could not keep the award he received from Israel after six relatives of his grandniece’s Palestinian husband were killed in Gaza last month.
lead_paragraph: Henk Zanoli, 91, who saved a Jewish boy in 1943, said he could not keep the award he received from Israel after six relatives of his grandniece’s Palestinian husband were killed in Gaza last month.
abstract: Dutch man Henk Zanoli returns medal he received from Israel for saving a Jewish boy from the Holocaust in 1943, saying that he cannot keep it after Israeli airstrike in Gaza kills six of his relatives; writes letter to the Israeli Embassy recounting terrible price his family paid for opposing Nazi tyranny, and the horrible cost it has now incurred at the hands of the Israeli attack; Zanoli's shifting opinion reflects growing criticism of Israel among Europeans since the 1960s.

headline.main: Resisting Nazis, He Saw Need for Israel. Now He Is Its Critic.
headline.print_headline: Resisting Nazis, He Saw Need for Israel. Now He Is Its Critic.

byline.contributor: Christopher F. Schuetze reported from The Hague, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza City.
byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER F. SCHUETZE and ANNE BARNARD

snippet: Syrian rebels killed 10 Lebanese troops and likely captured over a dozen more in a raid on a Lebanese border town, the country's military chief said, the most serious spillover of violence yet into the tiny country from its neighbor's civil war.
lead_paragraph: Syrian rebels killed 10 Lebanese troops and likely captured over a dozen more in a raid on a Lebanese border town, the country's military chief said, the most serious spillover of violence yet into the tiny country from its neighbor's civil war.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Kill 10, Capture Others in Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Kill 10, Capture Others in Lebanon

snippet: A ceasefire between the Lebanese army and militant Islamists collapsed on Tuesday as clashes resumed in a town near the Syrian border where the sides have been fighting since Saturday, a security source said.
lead_paragraph: A ceasefire between the Lebanese army and militant Islamists collapsed on Tuesday as clashes resumed in a town near the Syrian border where the sides have been fighting since Saturday, a security source said.

headline.main: Lebanon Army and Militants Clash as Ceasefire Collapses
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Army and Militants Clash as Ceasefire Collapses

snippet: The Lebanese government said on Monday there would be no political deal with Sunni militants who attacked the border town of Arsal at the weekend in the worst spillover from Syria's three-year-old civil war.
lead_paragraph: The Lebanese government said on Monday there would be no political deal with Sunni militants who attacked the border town of Arsal at the weekend in the worst spillover from Syria's three-year-old civil war.

headline.main: Lebanon Rules Out Political Deal With Militants
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Rules Out Political Deal With Militants

snippet: Eleven militants were killed in fighting with the Lebanese army near the Syrian border on Saturday, a Lebanese security official said, in a battle touched off by an attack on security forces in a town near the Syrian border.
lead_paragraph: Eleven militants were killed in fighting with the Lebanese army near the Syrian border on Saturday, a Lebanese security official said, in a battle touched off by an attack on security forces in a town near the Syrian border.

headline.print_headline: Eleven Gunmen Killed in Lebanon Fighting-Official

snippet: An official said at least five people had been wounded when a car bomb exploded near a cafe south of Beirut where people had gathered to watch World Cup matches.
lead_paragraph: An official said at least five people had been wounded when a car bomb exploded near a cafe south of Beirut where people had gathered to watch World Cup matches.
abstract: Powerful car bomb explosion rocks neigbhorhood in Lebanon's capital of Beirut, wounding several people; it is second blast in a week and comes amid mounting tensions over events in nearby Iraq.

headline.main: Bomb Injures at Least Five in Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Lebanon: Bombing Heightens Fear

snippet: Douglas McAuthur McCain’s death is an early clue for American officials as they try to identify the Americans who have joined ISIS.
lead_paragraph: Douglas McAuthur McCain’s death is an early clue for American officials as they try to identify the Americans who have joined ISIS.
abstract: Douglas McAuthur McCain becomes first American to die while fighting for Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; McCain's death in Syria, at hands of rival group Free Syrian Army, provides new insight for authorities as they try to learn more about ISIS and identify Americans who have joined the group.

headline.main: American Fighting for ISIS Is Killed in Syria
headline.print_headline: American in ISIS Is Killed in Clash

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Christina Capecchi from New Hope, Minn.; Ben Hubbard from Baghdad; Kristina Rebelo from San Diego; Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Kitty Bennett contributed research from Seattle.

snippet: As fighters continue to seize territory, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis, including many military officers under Saddam Hussein.
lead_paragraph: As fighters continue to seize territory, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis, including many military officers under Saddam Hussein.
abstract: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis, including many military officers who once served under Saddam Hussein; pedigree of group's leadership helps explain battlefield successes that have alarmed American and regional security officials, who say that ISIS fights more like a well-coordinated regional army than most insurgent groups.

headline.main: Military Skill and Terrorist Technique Fuel Success of ISIS
headline.print_headline: Trained in Army, ISIS Leaders Use Their Expertise

snippet: Former prime minister Saad al-Hariri returned to Lebanon on Friday for the first time in three years, on a visit seen as reasserting a moderate influence over the Sunni community following a deadly incursion by Islamist militants.
lead_paragraph: Former prime minister Saad al-Hariri returned to Lebanon on Friday for the first time in three years, on a visit seen as reasserting a moderate influence over the Sunni community following a deadly incursion by Islamist militants.

headline.main: Former PM Hariri Back in Lebanon for First Time in Three Years
headline.print_headline: Former PM Hariri Back in Lebanon for First Time in Three Years

snippet: Their presence in the heart of the capital raised new concerns among Lebanese who had cautiously been enjoying a renewed sense of security.
lead_paragraph: Their presence in the heart of the capital raised new concerns among Lebanese who had cautiously been enjoying a renewed sense of security.
abstract: Lebanese security forces arrest 17 men in two Beirut hotels on suspicion that they were plotting to assassinate prominent Lebanese Shiite leader and speaker of Parliament Nabih Berri; Lebanese officials say suspects are believed to belong to Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.
